title: Ticket #3318: job log doesn't show resources used when machine ad is referenced
description:
If you use an expression that references the machine ad for RequestCpus, RequestMemory, etc. The requested value will not be written into the job log in the job terminate event.

for example 

RequestCpus = TotalCpus
causes the Cpu's line to be entirely missing from the termnate event:
005 (081.000.000) 11/12 10:20:36 Job terminated.
        (1) Normal termination (return value 0)
                Usr 0 00:00:00, Sys 0 00:00:00  -  Run Remote Usage
                Usr 0 00:00:00, Sys 0 00:00:00  -  Run Local Usage
                Usr 0 00:00:00, Sys 0 00:00:00  -  Total Remote Usage
                Usr 0 00:00:00, Sys 0 00:00:00  -  Total Local Usage
        10133  -  Run Bytes Sent By Job
        1296  -  Run Bytes Received By Job
        10133  -  Total Bytes Sent By Job
        1296  -  Total Bytes Received By Job
        Partitionable Resources :    Usage  Request
           Disk (KB)            :      171      171
           Memory (MB)          :       10       10
remarks:
2012-Nov-14 16:48:15 by johnkn:
Note: there is code to print out Allocated resources, but it can't work because those attributes are in the machine ad, which is not available at the point where we create the terminate event.

The proposed solution is to propagate Cpus, Disk, Memory, etc from the machine ad to the job ad when the SCHEDD expands the job ad. At this time we will also evaluate RequestXXX attributes and, if they evaluate to a constant value, write the resulting constant back into the job ad. This solves the problem of 

RequestCpus = TotalCpus
not generating any useful output in the event log.

2012-Nov-15 15:31:16 by jfrey:
CODE REVIEW

  • In set_usageAd() and dollarDollarExpand(), you copy over integers, reals, booleans, and Error, but nothing else. If the attribute evalutes to an unexpected value, is it better to print 'Error' or 'Undefined' in the terminate event, or to leave that entry blank? The behavior is inconsistent.

  • In comment at qmgmt.cpp:3662, DiskProvisionedDisk should be DiskProvisioned?
